idioms.reading: じょうきょうしょうこ

idioms.meaning: the proof of the pudding is in the eating

lessons.japanese: 喫煙が健康に悪いと言う確固たる証拠がある。
lessons.english: We have absolute proof that smoking is bad for your health.
The proof of the pudding is in the eating.

lessons.japanese: 濡れたコートが彼の外出の証拠であった。
lessons.english: His wet coat was evidence that he had been outside.

lessons.japanese: ぬれたコートが彼が外にでていった証拠であった。
lessons.english: His wet coat was evidence that he had been outside.

lessons.japanese: ナイフの指紋が彼女の有罪の証拠である。
lessons.english: The fingerprints on the knife attest to her guilt.

lessons.japanese: どんな証拠があるというのだ。
どんな証拠があるんですか？
それと反対の証拠がないので、みんなは彼の話を信じている。
lessons.english: Everyone believes his story since there is no evidence to the contrary.

lessons.japanese: その話は証拠と一致する。
lessons.english: The story is consistent with the evidence.

lessons.japanese: その話が彼の体験に基づいているという証拠はない。
lessons.english: There is no evidence that the story is based on his own experience.

lessons.japanese: その証拠は彼の前回の証言と一致している。
lessons.english: The evidence corresponds to his previous statement.

lessons.japanese: その証拠は彼に有利であった。
lessons.english: The evidence was in his favor.

lessons.japanese: その証拠に疑問の余地はほとんどなかった。
lessons.english: The evidence left little room for doubt.
